lexUnit.name: seize.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to take by force, esp. despite the resistance of the current possessor or contrary to law

sentence.text: It also allows police to seize vehicles used to commit offences under the 1988 Act , such as manslaughter or furious and wanton driving .
German police have seized two consignments of highly radioactive material used in the nuclear power industry and in the manufacture of nuclear weapons .

THE American government has seized assets of a Chilean arms dealer who allegedly took part in a complex $1 billion ( £575m ) fraud that brought defence group Ferranti to the brink of collapse .
